list.title: LuCI
list.description: This is the LuCI base class. It is automatically instantiated and accessible using the global L variable.

list.title: LuCI#Class
list.description: Legacy L.Class class alias. New view code should use 'require baseclass'; to request the LuCI.baseclass class.

list.title: LuCI#Poll
list.description: Legacy L.Poll class alias. New view code should use 'require poll'; to request the LuCI.poll class.

list.title: LuCI#Request
list.description: Legacy L.Request class alias. New view code should use 'require request'; to request the LuCI.request class.

list.title: LuCI#bind
list.description: Return a bound function using the given self as this context and any further arguments as parameters to the bound function.

list.title: LuCI#dom
list.description: Legacy L.dom class alias. New view code should use 'require dom'; to request the LuCI.dom class.

list.title: LuCI#env
list.description: The env object holds environment settings used by LuCI, such as request timeouts, base URLs, etc.

list.title: LuCI#error
list.description: A wrapper around {@link LuCI#raise raise()} which also renders the error either as modal overlay when ui.js is already loaded or directly into the view body.

list.title: LuCI#fspath
list.description: Construct an absolute filesystem path relative to the server document root.

list.title: LuCI#get
list.description: Issues a GET request to the given url and invokes the specified callback function. The function is a wrapper around {@link LuCI.request#request Request.request()}.

list.title: LuCI#halt
list.description: Deprecated wrapper around {@link LuCI.poll.stop Poll.stop()}.

list.title: LuCI#hasSystemFeature
list.description: Test whether a particular system feature is available, such as hostapd SAE support or an installed firewall. The features are queried once at the beginning of the LuCI session and cached in SessionStorage throughout the lifetime of the associated tab or browser window.

list.title: LuCI#hasViewPermission
list.description: Check whether a view has sufficient permissions.

list.title: LuCI#isArguments
list.description: Tests whether the passed argument is a function arguments object.

list.title: LuCI#isObject
list.description: Tests whether the passed argument is a JavaScript object. This function is meant to be an object counterpart to the standard Array.isArray() function.

list.title: LuCI#location
list.description: Return the complete URL path to the current view.

list.title: LuCI#media
list.description:
Construct a URL path relative to the media resource path of the LuCI ui (usually /luci-static/$theme_name).

The resulting URL is guaranteed to contain only the characters a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _, ., %, ,, ;, and - as well as / for the path separator. Suffixing '?x=y&foo=bar' URI parameters also limited to the aforementioned characters is permissible.

list.title: LuCI#naturalCompare
list.description:
Compares two values numerically and returns -1, 0, or 1 depending on whether the first value is smaller, equal to, or larger than the second one respectively.

This function is meant to be used as a comparator function for Array.sort().

list.title: LuCI#path
list.description: Construct a relative URL path from the given prefix and parts. The resulting URL is guaranteed to contain only the characters a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _, ., %, ,, ;, and - as well as / for the path separator. Suffixing '?x=y&foo=bar' URI parameters also limited to the aforementioned characters is permissible.

list.title: LuCI#poll
list.description: Register a polling HTTP request that invokes the specified callback function. The function is a wrapper around {@link LuCI.request.poll#add Request.poll.add()}.

list.title: LuCI#post
list.description: Issues a POST request to the given url and invokes the specified callback function. The function is a wrapper around {@link LuCI.request#request Request.request()}. The request is sent using application/x-www-form-urlencoded encoding and will contain a field token with the current value of LuCI.env.token by default.

list.title: LuCI#raise
list.description: Captures the current stack trace and throws an error of the specified type as a new exception. Also logs the exception as an error to the debug console if it is available.

list.title: LuCI#require
list.description: Load an additional LuCI JavaScript class and its dependencies, instantiate it and return the resulting class instance. Each class is only loaded once. Subsequent attempts to load the same class will return the already instantiated class.

list.title: LuCI#resolveDefault
list.description: Returns a promise resolving with either the given value or with the given default in case the input value is a rejecting promise.

list.title: LuCI#resource
list.description:
Construct a URL path relative to the global static resource path of the LuCI ui (usually /luci-static/resources).

The resulting URL is guaranteed to contain only the characters a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _, ., %, ,, ;, and - as well as / for the path separator. Suffixing '?x=y&foo=bar' URI parameters also limited to the aforementioned characters is permissible.

list.title: LuCI#run
list.description: Deprecated wrapper around {@link LuCI.poll.start Poll.start()}.

list.title: LuCI#sortedArray
list.description: Converts the given value to an array using toArray() if needed, performs a numerical sort using naturalCompare() and returns the result. If the input already is an array, no copy is being made and the sorting is performed in-place.

list.title: LuCI#sortedKeys
list.description: Return an array of sorted object keys, optionally sorted by a different key or a different sorting mode.

list.title: LuCI#stop
list.description: Deprecated wrapper around {@link LuCI.poll.remove Poll.remove()}.

list.title: LuCI#toArray
list.description: Converts the given value to an array. If the given value is of type array, it is returned as-is, values of a type object are returned as one-element array containing the object, empty strings and null values are returned as an empty array, all other values are converted using String(), trimmed, split on white space and returned as an array.

list.title: LuCI#url
list.description:
Construct a URL with a path relative to the script path of the server side LuCI application (usually /cgi-bin/luci).

The resulting URL is guaranteed to contain only the characters a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _, ., %, ,, ;, and - as well as / for the path separator. Suffixing '?x=y&foo=bar' URI parameters also limited to the aforementioned characters is permissible.

list.title: LuCI#view
list.description: Legacy L.view class alias. New view code should use 'require view'; to request the LuCI.view class.

list.title: LuCI.baseclass#super
list.description:
Walks up the parent class chain and looks for a class member called key in any of the parent classes this class inherits from. Returns the member value of the superclass or calls the member as a function and returns its return value when the optional callArgs array is given.

This function has two signatures and is sensitive to the amount of arguments passed to it:

  • super('key') - Returns the value of key when found within one of the parent classes.
  • super('key', ['arg1', 'arg2']) - Calls the key() method with parameters arg1 and arg2 when found within one of the parent classes.

list.title: LuCI.baseclass#toString
list.description: Returns a string representation of this class.

list.title: LuCI.baseclass#varargs
list.description: Extract all values from the given argument array beginning from offset and prepend any further given optional parameters to the beginning of the resulting array copy.

list.title: LuCI.baseclass.extend
list.description: Extends this base class with the properties described in properties and returns a new subclassed Class instance

list.title: LuCI.baseclass.instantiate
list.description: Calls the class constructor using new with the given argument array being passed as variadic parameters to the constructor.

list.title: LuCI.baseclass.isSubclass
list.description: Checks whether the given class value is a subclass of this class.

list.title: LuCI.baseclass.singleton
list.description:
Extends this base class with the properties described in properties, instantiates the resulting subclass using the given arguments passed to this function and returns the resulting subclassed Class instance.

This function serves as a convenience shortcut for {@link LuCI.baseclass.extend Class.extend()} and subsequent new.

list.title: LuCI.dom#append
list.description: Appends the given children data to the given node.

list.title: LuCI.dom#attr
list.description: Sets attributes or registers event listeners on element nodes.

list.title: LuCI.dom#bindClassInstance
list.description:
Binds the given class instance to the specified DOM Node.

This function uses the dom.data() facility to attach the passed instance of a Class to a node. This is needed for complex widget elements or similar where the corresponding class instance responsible for the element must be retrieved from DOM nodes obtained by querySelector() or similar means.

list.title: LuCI.dom#callClassMethod
list.description: Finds a bound class instance on the given node itself or the first bound instance on its closest parent node and invokes the specified method name on the found class instance.

list.title: LuCI.dom#content
list.description:
Replaces the content of the given node with the given children.

This function first removes any children of the given DOM Node and then adds the given children following the rules outlined below.

list.title: LuCI.dom#create
list.description:
Creates a new DOM Node from the given html, attr and data parameters.

This function has multiple signatures, it can be either invoked in the form create(html[, attr[, data]]) or in the form create(html[, data]). The used variant is determined from the type of the second argument.

list.title: LuCI.dom#data
list.description:
Attaches or detaches arbitrary data to and from a DOM Node.

This function is useful to attach non-string values or runtime data that is not serializable to DOM nodes. To decouple data from the DOM, values are not added directly to nodes, but inserted into a registry instead which is then referenced by a string key stored as data-idref attribute in the node.

This function has multiple signatures and is sensitive to the number of arguments passed to it.

  • dom.data(node) - Fetches all data associated with the given node.
  • dom.data(node, key) - Fetches a specific key associated with the given node.
  • dom.data(node, key, val) - Sets a specific key to the given value associated with the given node.
  • dom.data(node, null) - Clears any data associated with the node.
  • dom.data(node, key, null) - Clears the given key associated with the node.

list.title: LuCI.dom#elem
list.description: Tests whether the given argument is a valid DOM Node.

list.title: LuCI.dom#findClassInstance
list.description: Finds a bound class instance on the given node itself or the first bound instance on its closest parent node.

list.title: LuCI.dom#isEmpty
list.description:
Tests whether a given DOM Node instance is empty or appears empty.

Any element child nodes which have the CSS class hidden set or for which the optionally passed ignoreFn callback function returns false are ignored.

list.title: LuCI.dom#matches
list.description:
Tests whether a given Node matches the given query selector.

This function is a convenience wrapper around the standard Node.matches("selector") function with the added benefit that the node argument may be a non-Node value, in which case this function simply returns false.

list.title: LuCI.dom#parent
list.description:
Returns the closest parent node that matches the given query selector expression.

This function is a convenience wrapper around the standard Node.closest("selector") function with the added benefit that the node argument may be a non-Node value, in which case this function simply returns null.

list.title: LuCI.dom#parse
list.description: Parses a given string as HTML and returns the first child node.

list.title: LuCI.dom~ignoreCallbackFn
list.description:
The ignore callback function is invoked by isEmpty() for each child node to decide whether to ignore a child node or not.

When this function returns false, the node passed to it is ignored, else not.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractElement#append
list.description: Add another form element as children to this element.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractElement#parse
list.description:
Parse this element's form input.

The parse() function recursively walks the form element tree and triggers input value reading and validation for each encountered element.

Elements which are hidden due to unsatisfied dependencies are skipped.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractElement#render
list.description:
Render the form element.

The render() function recursively walks the form element tree and renders the markup for each element, returning the assembled DOM tree.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractElement#stripTags
list.description: Strip any HTML tags from the given input string, and decode HTML entities.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractElement#titleFn
list.description:
Format the given named property as a title string.

This function looks up the given named property and formats its value suitable for use as an element caption or description string. It also strips any HTML tags from the result.

If the property value is a string, it is passed to String.format() along with any additional parameters passed to titleFn().

If the property value is a function, it is invoked with any additional titleFn() parameters as arguments, and the obtained return value is converted to a string.

In all other cases, null is returned.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#cfgsections
list.description: Enumerate the UCI section IDs covered by this form section element.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#cfgvalue
list.description:
Query underlying option configuration values.

This function is sensitive to the amount of arguments passed to it; if only one argument is specified, the configuration values of all options within this section are returned as a dictionary.

If both the section ID and an option name are supplied, this function returns the configuration value of the specified option only.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#filter
list.description:
Filter UCI section IDs to render.

The filter function is invoked for each UCI section ID of a given type and controls whether the given UCI section is rendered or ignored by the form section element.

The default implementation always returns true. User code or classes extending {@link LuCI.form.AbstractSection AbstractSection} may override this function with custom implementations.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#formvalue
list.description:
Query the underlying option widget input values.

This function is sensitive to the amount of arguments passed to it; if only one argument is specified, the widget input values of all options within this section are returned as a dictionary.

If both the section ID and an option name are supplied, this function returns the widget input value of the specified option only.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#getOption
list.description:
Obtain underlying option objects.

This function is sensitive to the amount of arguments passed to it; if no option name is specified, all options within this section are returned as a dictionary.

If an option name is supplied, this function returns the matching LuCI.form.AbstractValue instance only.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#getUIElement
list.description:
Obtain underlying option LuCI.ui widget instances.

This function is sensitive to the amount of arguments passed to it; if only one argument is specified, the LuCI.ui widget instances of all options within this section are returned as a dictionary.

If both the section ID and an option name are supplied, this function returns the LuCI.ui widget instance value of the specified option only.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#load
list.description:
Load the configuration covered by this section.

The load() function recursively walks the section element tree and invokes the load function of each child option element.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#option
list.description:
Add a configuration option widget to the section.

Note that [taboption()]{@link LuCI.form.AbstractSection#taboption} should be used instead if this form section element uses tabs.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#parentoption
list.description:
Access the parent option container instance.

In case this section is nested within an option element container, this property will hold a reference to the parent option instance.

If this section is not nested, the property is null.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#parse
list.description:
Parse this sections form input.

The parse() function recursively walks the section element tree and triggers input value reading and validation for each encountered child option element.

Options which are hidden due to unsatisfied dependencies are skipped.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#tab
list.description:
Add an option tab to the section.

The child option elements of a section may be divided into multiple tabs to provide a better overview to the user.

Before options can be moved into a tab pane, the corresponding tab has to be defined first, which is done by calling this function.

Note that once tabs are defined, user code must use the taboption() method to add options to specific tabs. Option elements added by option() will not be assigned to any tab and not be rendered in this case.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractSection#taboption
list.description: Add a configuration option widget to a tab of the section.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#cbid
list.description:
Obtain the internal ID ("cbid") of the element instance.

Since each form section element may map multiple underlying configuration sections, the configuration section ID is required to form a fully qualified ID pointing to the specific element instance within the given specific section.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#cfgvalue
list.description:
Query the underlying configuration value.

The default implementation of this method returns the cached return value of [load()]{@link LuCI.form.AbstractValue#load}. It may be overridden by user code to obtain the configuration value in a different way.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#datatype
list.description:
Specifies a datatype constraint expression to validate input values against. Refer to {@link LuCI.validation} for details on the format.

If the user entered input does not match the datatype validation, the option element is marked as invalid.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#default
list.description: Sets a default value to use when the underlying UCI option is not set.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#depends
list.description:
Add a dependency constraint to the option.

Dependency constraints allow making the presence of option elements dependent on the current values of certain other options within the same form. An option element with unsatisfied dependencies will be hidden from the view and its current value omitted when saving.

Multiple constraints (that is, multiple calls to depends()) are treated as alternatives, forming a logical "or" expression.

By passing an object of name => value pairs as the first argument, it is possible to depend on multiple options simultaneously, forming a logical "and" expression.

Option names may be given in "dot notation" which allows referencing option elements outside the current form section. If a name without a dot is specified, it refers to an option within the same configuration section. If specified as configname.sectionid.optionname, options anywhere within the same form may be specified.

The object notation also allows for a number of special keys which are not treated as option names but as modifiers to influence the dependency constraint evaluation. The associated value of these special "tag" keys is ignored. The recognized tags are:

  • !reverse
    Invert the dependency, instead of requiring another option to be equal to the dependency value, that option should not be equal.
  • !contains
    Instead of requiring an exact match, the dependency is considered satisfied when the dependency value is contained within the option value.
  • !default
    The dependency is always satisfied

Examples:

  • opt.depends("foo", "test")
    Require the value of `foo` to be `test`.
  • opt.depends({ foo: "test" })
    Equivalent to the previous example.
  • opt.depends({ foo: /test/ })
    Require the value of `foo` to match the regular expression `/test/`.
  • opt.depends({ foo: "test", bar: "qrx" })
    Require the value of `foo` to be `test` and the value of `bar` to be `qrx`.
  • opt.depends({ foo: "test" })
    opt.depends({ bar: "qrx" })
    Require either foo to be set to test, or the bar option to be qrx.
  • opt.depends("test.section1.foo", "bar")
    Require the "foo" form option within the "section1" section to be set to "bar".
  • opt.depends({ foo: "test", "!contains": true })
    Require the "foo" option value to contain the substring "test".

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#editable
list.description:
Mark the grid section option element as editable.

Options which are displayed in the table portion of a {@link LuCI.form.GridSection GridSection} instance are rendered as readonly text by default. By setting the editable property of a child option element to true, that element is rendered as a full input widget within its cell instead of a text only preview.

This property has no effect on options that are not children of grid section elements.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#formvalue
list.description:
Query the current form input value.

The default implementation of this method returns the current input value of the underlying [LuCI.ui]{@link LuCI.ui.AbstractElement} widget. It may be overridden by user code to handle input values differently.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#getUIElement
list.description: Obtain the underlying LuCI.ui element instance.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#getValidationError
list.description: Returns the current validation error for this input.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#isActive
list.description:
Test whether the option element is currently active.

An element is active when it is not hidden due to unsatisfied dependency constraints.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#isValid
list.description: Test whether the input value is currently valid.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#load
list.description:
Load the underlying configuration value.

The default implementation of this method reads and returns the underlying UCI option value (or the related JavaScript property for {@link LuCI.form.JSONMap JSONMap} instances). It may be overridden by user code to load data from non-standard sources.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#modalonly
list.description:
Move the grid section option element into the table, the modal popup or both.

If this property is null (the default), the option element is displayed in both the table preview area and the per-section instance modal popup of a grid section. When it is set to false the option is only shown in the table but not the modal popup. When set to true, the option is only visible in the modal popup but not the table.

This property has no effect on options that are not children of grid section elements.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#onchange
list.description:
Register a custom value change handler.

If this property is set to a function, it is invoked whenever the value of the underlying UI input element changes.

The invoked handler function will receive the DOM click element as first and the underlying configuration section ID as well as the input value as second and third argument respectively.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#optional
list.description: If set to true, the underlying ui input widget is allowed to be empty, otherwise the option element is marked invalid when no value is entered or selected by the user.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#parse
list.description:
Parse the option element input.

The function is invoked when the parse() method has been invoked on the parent form and triggers input value reading and validation.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#readonly
list.description:
Make option element readonly.

This property defaults to the readonly state of the parent form element. When set to true, the underlying widget is rendered in disabled state, meaning its contents cannot be changed and the widget cannot be interacted with.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#remove
list.description:
Remove the corresponding value from the configuration.

This function is invoked upon saving the parent form when the option element has been hidden due to unsatisfied dependencies or when the user cleared the input value and the option is marked optional.

The default implementation simply removes the associated option from the UCI configuration (or the associated JavaScript object property in case of {@link LuCI.form.JSONMap JSONMap} forms). It may be overridden by user code to implement alternative removal logic, e.g. to retain the original value.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#retain
list.description: If set to true, the underlying ui input widget value is not cleared from the configuration on unsatisfied dependencies. The default behavior is to remove the values of all options whose dependencies are not fulfilled.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#rmempty
list.description: If set to false, the underlying option value is retained upon saving the form when the option element is disabled due to unsatisfied dependency constraints.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#textvalue
list.description:
Obtain a textual input representation.

The default implementation of this method returns the HTML-escaped current input value of the underlying [LuCI.ui]{@link LuCI.ui.AbstractElement} widget. User code or specific option element implementations may override this function to apply a different logic, e.g. to return Yes or No depending on the checked state of checkbox elements.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#uciconfig
list.description:
Override the UCI configuration name to read the option value from.

By default, the configuration name is inherited from the parent Map. By setting this property, a deviating configuration may be specified.

The default of null means inherit from the parent form.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#ucioption
list.description:
Override the UCI option name to read the value from.

By default, the elements name, which is passed as the third argument to the constructor, is used as the UCI option name. By setting this property, a deviating UCI option may be specified.

The default of null means use the option element name.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#ucisection
list.description:
Override the UCI section name to read the option value from.

By default, the section ID is inherited from the parent section element. By setting this property, a deviating section may be specified.

The default of null means inherit from the parent section.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#validate
list.description:
Specifies a custom validation function to test the user input for validity. The validation function must return true to accept the value. Any other return value type is converted to a string and displayed to the user as a validation error message.

If the user entered input does not pass the validation function, the option element is marked as invalid.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#validate
list.description:
Apply custom validation logic.

This method is invoked whenever incremental validation is performed on the user input, e.g. on keyup or blur events.

The default implementation of this method does nothing and always returns true. User code may override this method to provide additional validation logic which is not covered by data type constraints.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#width
list.description:
Override the cell width of a table or grid section child option.

If the property is set to a numeric value, it is treated as pixel width which is set on the containing cell element of the option, essentially forcing a certain column width. When the property is set to a string value, it is applied as-is to the CSS width property.

This property has no effect on options that are not children of grid or table section elements.

list.title: LuCI.form.AbstractValue#write
list.description:
Write the current input value into the configuration.

This function is invoked upon saving the parent form when the option element is valid and when its input value has been changed compared to the initial value returned by [cfgvalue()]{@link LuCI.form.AbstractValue#cfgvalue}.

The default implementation simply sets the given input value in the UCI configuration (or the associated JavaScript object property in case of {@link LuCI.form.JSONMap JSONMap} forms). It may be overridden by user code to implement alternative save logic, e.g. to transform the input value before it is written.

list.title: LuCI.form.Button#inputstyle
list.description:
Override the button style class.

By setting this property, a specific cbi-button-* CSS class can be selected to influence the style of the resulting button.

Suitable values which are implemented by most themes are positive, negative and primary.

The default of null means a neutral button styling is used.

list.title: LuCI.form.Button#inputtitle
list.description:
Override the rendered button caption.

By default, the option title - which is passed as the fourth argument to the constructor - is used as a caption for the button element. When setting this property to a string, it is used as a String.format() pattern with the underlying UCI section name passed as the first format argument. When set to a function, it is invoked passing the section ID as the sole argument, and the resulting return value is converted to a string before being used as a button caption.

The default of null means the option title is used as caption.

list.title: LuCI.form.Button#onclick
list.description:
Override the button click action.

By default, the underlying UCI option (or default property) value is copied into a hidden field tied to the button element and the save action is triggered on the parent form element.

When this property is set to a function, it is invoked instead of performing the default actions. The handler function will receive the DOM click element as the first and the underlying configuration section ID as the second argument.

list.title: LuCI.form.DirectoryPicker#browser
list.description: Render the widget in browser mode initially instead of a button to 'Select Directory...'.

list.title: LuCI.form.DirectoryPicker#directory_create
list.description:
Toggle remote directory create functionality.

When set to true, the underlying widget provides a button which lets the user create directories. Note that this is merely a cosmetic feature: remote create permissions are controlled by the session ACL rules.

The default of false means the directory create button is hidden.

list.title: LuCI.form.DirectoryPicker#enable_download
list.description: Toggle download file functionality.

list.title: LuCI.form.DirectoryPicker#enable_remove
list.description:
Toggle remote file delete functionality.

When set to true, the underlying widget provides buttons which let the user delete files from remote directories. Note that this is merely a cosmetic feature: remote delete permissions are controlled by the session ACL rules.

The default is false, means file removal buttons are not displayed.

list.title: LuCI.form.DirectoryPicker#enable_upload
list.description:
Toggle file upload functionality.

When set to true, the underlying widget provides a button which lets the user select and upload local files to the remote system. Note that this is merely a cosmetic feature: remote upload access is controlled by the session ACL rules.

The default of false means file upload functionality is disabled.

list.title: LuCI.form.DirectoryPicker#root_directory
list.description:
Specify the root directory for file browsing.

This property defines the topmost directory the file browser widget may navigate to. The UI will not allow browsing directories outside this prefix. Note that this is merely a cosmetic feature: remote file access and directory listing permissions are controlled by the session ACL rules.

The default is /tmp.

list.title: LuCI.form.DirectoryPicker#show_hidden
list.description:
Toggle display of hidden files.

Display hidden files when rendering the remote directory listing. Note that this is merely a cosmetic feature: hidden files are always included in received remote file listings.

The default of true means hidden files are displayed.

list.title: LuCI.form.DummyValue#hidden
list.description:
Render the UCI option value as hidden using the HTML 'display: none' style property.

By default, the value is displayed.

list.title: LuCI.form.DummyValue#href
list.description:
Set a URL which is opened when clicking on the dummy value text.

By setting this property, the dummy value text is wrapped in an <a> element with the property value used as href attribute.

list.title: LuCI.form.DummyValue#rawhtml
list.description:
Treat the UCI option value (or the default property value) as HTML.

By default, the value text is HTML escaped before being rendered as text. In some cases, HTML content may need to be interpreted and rendered as-is. When set to true, HTML escaping is disabled.

list.title: LuCI.form.DynamicList#allowduplicates
list.description:
Allows the underlying form controls to have multiple identical values.

Default is null. If true, the underlying form value will not be checked for duplication.

list.title: LuCI.form.FileUpload#browser
list.description: Render the widget in browser mode initially instead of a button to 'Select File...'.

list.title: LuCI.form.FileUpload#directory_create
list.description:
Toggle remote directory create functionality.

When set to true, the underlying widget provides a button which lets the user create directories. Note that this is merely a cosmetic feature: remote create permissions are controlled by the session ACL rules.

The default of false means the directory create button is hidden.

list.title: LuCI.form.FileUpload#directory_select
list.description:
Toggle remote directory select functionality.

When set to true, the underlying widget changes behaviour to select directories instead of files, in effect, becoming a directory picker.

The default is false.

list.title: LuCI.form.FileUpload#enable_download
list.description: Toggle download file functionality.

list.title: LuCI.form.FileUpload#enable_remove
list.description:
Toggle remote file delete functionality.

When set to true, the underlying widget provides buttons which let the user delete files from remote directories. Note that this is merely a cosmetic feature: remote delete permissions are controlled by the session ACL rules.

The default is true, means file removal buttons are displayed.

list.title: LuCI.form.FileUpload#enable_upload
list.description:
Toggle file upload functionality.

When set to true, the underlying widget provides a button which lets the user select and upload local files to the remote system. Note that this is merely a cosmetic feature: remote upload access is controlled by the session ACL rules.

The default of true means file upload functionality is displayed.

list.title: LuCI.form.FileUpload#root_directory
list.description:
Specify the root directory for file browsing.

This property defines the topmost directory the file browser widget may navigate to. The UI will not allow browsing directories outside this prefix. Note that this is merely a cosmetic feature: remote file access and directory listing permissions are controlled by the session ACL rules.

The default is /etc/luci-uploads.

list.title: LuCI.form.FileUpload#show_hidden
list.description:
Toggle display of hidden files.

Display hidden files when rendering the remote directory listing. Note that this is merely a cosmetic feature: hidden files are always included in received remote file listings.

The default of false means hidden files are not displayed.

list.title: LuCI.form.Flag#disabled
list.description: Sets the input value to use for the checkbox unchecked state.

list.title: LuCI.form.Flag#enabled
list.description: Sets the input value to use for the checkbox checked state.

list.title: LuCI.form.Flag#tooltip
list.description:
Set a tooltip for the flag option.

Set to a string, it will be used as-is as a tooltip.

Set to a function, the function will be invoked and the return value will be shown as a tooltip. If the return value of the function is null no tooltip will be set.

list.title: LuCI.form.Flag#tooltipicon
list.description:
Set a tooltip icon for the flag option.

If set, this icon will be shown for the default one. This could also be a png icon from the resources directory.

list.title: LuCI.form.GridSection#tab
list.description:
Add an option tab to the section.

The modal option elements of a grid section may be divided into multiple tabs to provide a better overview to the user.

Before options can be moved into a tab pane, the corresponding tab has to be defined first, which is done by calling this function.

Note that tabs are only effective in modal popups. Options added with option() will not be assigned to a specific tab and are rendered in the table view only.

list.title: LuCI.form.ListValue#orientation
list.description:
Set the orientation of the underlying radio or checkbox elements.

May be one of horizontal or vertical. Only applies to non-select widget types.

list.title: LuCI.form.ListValue#size
list.description: Set the size attribute of the underlying HTML select element.

list.title: LuCI.form.ListValue#widget
list.description:
Set the type of the underlying form controls.

May be one of select or radio. If set to select, an HTML select element is rendered, otherwise a collection of radio elements is used.

list.title: LuCI.form.Map#chain
list.description:
Tie another UCI configuration to the map.

By default, a map instance will only load the UCI configuration file specified in the constructor, but sometimes access to values from further configuration files is required. This function allows for such use cases by registering further UCI configuration files which are needed by the map.

list.title: LuCI.form.Map#findElement
list.description:
Return the first DOM node within this Map which matches the given search parameters. This function is essentially a convenience wrapper around findElements() which only returns the first found node.

This function is sensitive to the amount of arguments passed to it; if only one argument is specified, it is used as selector-expression as-is. When two arguments are passed, the first argument is treated as an attribute name, the second one as an attribute value to match.

As an example, map.findElement('input') would find the first <input> node while map.findElement('type', 'text') would find the first DOM node with a type="text" attribute.

list.title: LuCI.form.Map#findElements
list.description:
Return all DOM nodes within this Map which match the given search parameters. This function is essentially a convenience wrapper around querySelectorAll().

This function is sensitive to the amount of arguments passed to it; if only one argument is specified, it is used as selector-expression as-is. When two arguments are passed, the first argument is treated as an attribute name, the second one as an attribute value to match.

As an example, map.findElements('input') would find all <input> nodes while map.findElements('type', 'text') would find any DOM node with a type="text" attribute.

list.title: LuCI.form.Map#load
list.description:
Load the configuration covered by this map.

The load() function first loads all referenced UCI configurations, then it recursively walks the form element tree and invokes the load function of each child element.

list.title: LuCI.form.Map#lookupOption
list.description: Find a form option element instance.

list.title: LuCI.form.Map#parse
list.description:
Parse the form input values.

The parse() function recursively walks the form element tree and triggers input value reading and validation for each child element.

Elements which are hidden due to unsatisfied dependencies are skipped.

list.title: LuCI.form.Map#readonly
list.description:
Toggle readonly state of the form.

If set to true, the Map instance is marked readonly and any form option elements added to it will inherit the readonly state.

If left unset, the Map will test the access permission of the primary uci configuration upon loading and mark the form readonly if no write permissions are granted.

list.title: LuCI.form.Map#render
list.description: Render the form markup.

list.title: LuCI.form.Map#reset
list.description: Reset the form by re-rendering its contents. This will revert all unsaved user inputs to their initial form state.

list.title: LuCI.form.Map#save
list.description:
Save the form input values.

This function parses the current form, saves the resulting UCI changes, reloads the UCI configuration data and redraws the form elements.

list.title: LuCI.form.Map#section
list.description:
Add a configuration section to the map.

LuCI forms follow the structure of the underlying UCI configurations. This means that a map, which represents a single UCI configuration, is divided into multiple sections which in turn contain an arbitrary number of options.

While UCI itself only knows two kinds of sections - named and anonymous ones - the form class offers various flavors of form section elements to present configuration sections in different ways. Refer to the documentation of the different section classes for details.

list.title: LuCI.form.MultiValue#create
list.description: Allows custom value entry in addition to those already specified.

list.title: LuCI.form.MultiValue#display_size
list.description: Allows specifying the [display_items]{@link LuCI.ui.Dropdown.InitOptions} property of the underlying dropdown widget. If omitted, the value of the size property is used or 3 when size is also unspecified.

list.title: LuCI.form.MultiValue#dropdown_size
list.description: Allows specifying the [dropdown_items]{@link LuCI.ui.Dropdown.InitOptions} property of the underlying dropdown widget. If omitted, the value of the size property is used or -1 when size is also unspecified.

list.title: LuCI.form.NamedSection#cfgsections
list.description: The NamedSection class overrides the generic cfgsections() implementation to return a one-element array containing the mapped section ID as a sole element. User code should not normally change this.

list.title: LuCI.form.NamedSection.addremove
list.description: Set to true, the user may remove or recreate the sole mapped configuration instance from the form section widget, otherwise only a pre-existing section may be edited. The default is false.

list.title: LuCI.form.NamedSection.hidetitle
list.description: If set to true, the title caption of the form section element which is normally rendered before the start of the section content will not be rendered in the UI. The default is false, meaning that the title is rendered.

list.title: LuCI.form.NamedSection.uciconfig
list.description: Override the UCI configuration name to read the section IDs from. By default, the configuration name is inherited from the parent Map. By setting this property, a deviating configuration may be specified. The default of null means inherit from the parent form.

list.title: LuCI.form.RangeSliderValue#calculate
list.description:
Override the calculate action.

When this property is set to a function, it is invoked when the slider is adjusted. This might be useful to calculate and display a result which is more meaningful than the currently chosen value. The calculated value is displayed below the slider.

list.title: LuCI.form.RangeSliderValue#calcunits
list.description:
Define the units of the calculated value.

Suffix a unit string to the calculated value, e.g. 'seconds' or 'dBm'.

list.title: LuCI.form.RangeSliderValue#default
list.description: Set the default value for the slider. The default value is elided during save: meaning, a currently chosen value which matches the default is not saved.

list.title: LuCI.form.RangeSliderValue#formvalue
list.description: Query the current form input value.

list.title: LuCI.form.RangeSliderValue#max
list.description: Maximum value the slider can represent.

list.title: LuCI.form.RangeSliderValue#min
list.description: Minimum value the slider can represent.

list.title: LuCI.form.RangeSliderValue#step
list.description: Step size for each tick of the slider, or the special value "any" when handling arbitrary precision floating point numbers.

list.title: LuCI.form.RichListValue#orientation
list.description:
Set the orientation of the underlying radio or checkbox elements.

May be one of horizontal or vertical. Only applies to non-select widget types.

list.title: LuCI.form.RichListValue#size
list.description: Set the size attribute of the underlying HTML select element.

list.title: LuCI.form.RichListValue#value
list.description: Add a predefined choice to the form option. By adding one or more choices, the plain text input field is turned into a combobox widget which prompts the user to select a predefined choice, or to enter a custom value.

list.title: LuCI.form.RichListValue#widget
list.description:
Set the type of the underlying form controls.

May be one of select or radio. If set to select, an HTML select element is rendered, otherwise a collection of radio elements is used.

list.title: LuCI.form.SectionValue.subsection
list.description:
Access the embedded section instance.

This property holds a reference to the instantiated nested section.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#actionstitle
list.description: Set a custom text for the actions column header row when actions buttons are present.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#addModalOptions
list.description:
Add further options to the per-section instanced modal popup.

This function may be overridden by user code to perform additional setup steps before displaying the more options modal which is useful to e.g. query additional data or to inject further option elements.

The default implementation of this function does nothing.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#cloneable
list.description: Set to true, a clone button is added to the button column, allowing the user to clone section instances mapped by the section form element. The default is false.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#clonebtntitle
list.description: Override the caption used for the section clone button at the bottom of the section form element. Set to a string, it will be used as-is. Set to a function, the function will be invoked and its return value is used as a caption, after converting it to a string. If this property is not set, the default is Clone.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#extedit
list.description:
Enables a per-section instance row Edit button which triggers a certain action when clicked. Set to a string, the string value is used as a String.format() pattern with the name of the underlying UCI section as the first format argument. The result is then interpreted as a URL which LuCI will navigate to when the user clicks the edit button.

If set to a function, this function will be registered as a click event handler on the rendered edit button, receiving the section instance name as the first and the DOM click event as the second argument.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#filterrow
list.description:
Optional table filtering for table sections.

Set filterrow to true to display a filter header row in the generated table with per-column text fields to search for string matches in the column. The filter row appears after the titles row.

The filters work cumulatively: text in each field shall match an entry for the row to be displayed. The results are filtered live. Matching is case-sensitive, and partial, i.e. part or all of the result includes the search string.

The filter fields assume the placeholder text Filter suffixed with the column name, to ease correlation of filter fields to their corresponding column entries on narrow displays which might fold the columns over multiple lines.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#footer
list.description:
Optional footer row for table sections.

Set footer to one of:

  • a function that returns a table row (tr) or node E('...')
  • an array of string cell contents (first entry maps to the name column if present).

This is useful for providing sum totals, extra function buttons or extra space.

The default implementation returns an empty node.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#max_cols
list.description: Specify a maximum amount of columns to display. By default, one table column is rendered for each child option of the form section element. When this option is set to a positive number, then no more columns than the given amount are rendered. When the number of child options exceeds the specified amount, a More button is rendered in the last column, opening a modal dialog presenting all options elements in NamedSection style when clicked.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#modaltitle
list.description: Override the per-section instance modal popup title caption shown when clicking the More button in a section specifying max_cols. Set to a string, it will be used as a String.format() pattern with the name of the underlying UCI section as the first argument. Set to a function, the function will be invoked with the section name as the first argument, and its return value is used as a caption after converting it to a string. If this property is not set, the default is the name of the underlying UCI configuration section.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#nodescriptions
list.description: Set to true, the header row with the descriptions of options will not be displayed. By default, the row of descriptions is automatically displayed when at least one option has a description.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#rowcolors
list.description: Set to true, alternating cbi-rowstyle-1 and cbi-rowstyle-2 CSS classes are added to the table row elements. Not all LuCI themes implement these row style classes. The default is false.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#sectiontitle
list.description: Override the per-section instance title caption shown in the first column of the table unless anonymous is set to true. Set to a string, it will be used as a String.format() pattern with the name of the underlying UCI section as the first argument. Set to a function, the function will be invoked with the section name as the first argument and its return value used as a caption, after converting it to a string. If this property is not set, the default is the name of the underlying UCI configuration section.

list.title: LuCI.form.TableSection#sortable
list.description: Set to true, a sort button is added to the last column, allowing the user to reorder the section instances mapped by the section form element.

list.title: LuCI.form.TextValue#cols
list.description: Allows specifying the [cols]{@link LuCI.ui.Textarea.InitOptions} property of the underlying textarea widget.

list.title: LuCI.form.TextValue#monospace
list.description: Enforces the use of a monospace font for the textarea contents when set to true.

list.title: LuCI.form.TextValue#rows
list.description: Allows specifying the [rows]{@link LuCI.ui.Textarea.InitOptions} property of the underlying textarea widget.

list.title: LuCI.form.TextValue#wrap
list.description: Allows specifying the [wrap]{@link LuCI.ui.Textarea.InitOptions} property of the underlying textarea widget.

list.title: LuCI.form.TypedSection#addbtntitle
list.description: Override the caption used for the section add button at the bottom of the section form element. Set to a string, it will be used as-is. Set to a function, the function will be invoked and its return value is used as a caption, after converting it to a string. If this property is not set, the default is Add.

list.title: LuCI.form.TypedSection#addremove
list.description: If set to true, the user may add or remove instances from the form section widget, otherwise only pre-existing sections may be edited. The default is false.

list.title: LuCI.form.TypedSection#anonymous
list.description: If set to true, mapped section instances are treated as anonymous UCI sections, which means that section instance elements will be rendered without a title element and that no name is required when adding new sections. The default is false.

list.title: LuCI.form.TypedSection#delbtntitle
list.description: Override the caption used for the section delete button at the bottom of the section form element. Set to a string, it will be used as-is. Set to a function, the function will be invoked and its return value is used as a caption, after converting it to a string. If this property is not set, the default is Delete.

list.title: LuCI.form.TypedSection#hidetitle
list.description: If set to true, the title caption of the form section element which is normally rendered before the start of the section content will not be rendered in the UI. The default is false, meaning that the title is rendered.

list.title: LuCI.form.TypedSection#tabbed
list.description: When set to true, instead of rendering section instances one below another, treat each instance as a separate tab pane and render a tab menu at the top of the form section element, allowing the user to switch among instances. The default is false.

list.title: LuCI.form.TypedSection#uciconfig
list.description: Override the UCI configuration name to read the section IDs from. By default, the configuration name is inherited from the parent Map. By setting this property, a deviating configuration may be specified. The default of null means inherit from the parent form.

list.title: LuCI.form.Value#password
list.description: If set to true, the field is rendered as a password input, otherwise as a plain text input.

list.title: LuCI.form.Value#placeholder
list.description: Set a placeholder string to use when the input field is empty.

list.title: LuCI.form.Value#value
list.description: Add a predefined choice to the form option. By adding one or more choices, the plain text input field is turned into a combobox widget which prompts the user to select a predefined choice, or to enter a custom value.

list.title: LuCI.fs#exec
list.description:
Execute the specified command, optionally passing params and environment variables.

Note: The command must be either the path to an executable, or a basename without arguments in which case it will be searched in $PATH. If specified, the values given in params will be passed as arguments to the command.

The key/value pairs in the optional env table are translated to setenv() calls prior to running the command.

list.title: LuCI.fs#exec_direct
list.description:
Execute the specified command, bypassing ubus.

Note: The command must be either the path to an executable, or a basename without arguments in which case it will be searched in $PATH. If specified, the values given in params will be passed as arguments to the command.

This function will invoke the requested commands through the cgi-io helper applet at /cgi-bin/cgi-exec which bypasses the ubus rpc transport. This is useful to fetch large command outputs which might exceed the ubus message size limits or which contain binary data.

The cgi-io helper will enforce the same access permission rules as the ubus based exec call.

list.title: LuCI.fs#lines
list.description:
Read the contents of the given file, split it into lines, trim leading and trailing white space of each line and return the resulting array.

This function is guaranteed to not reject its promises, on failure, an empty array will be returned.

list.title: LuCI.fs#list
list.description: Obtains a listing of the specified directory.

list.title: LuCI.fs#read
list.description: Read the contents of the given file and return them. Note: this function is unsuitable for obtaining binary data.

list.title: LuCI.fs#read_direct
list.description:
Read the contents of the given file and return them, bypassing ubus.

This function will read the requested file through the cgi-io helper applet at /cgi-bin/cgi-download which bypasses the ubus rpc transport. This is useful to fetch large file contents which might exceed the ubus message size limits or which contain binary data.

The cgi-io helper will enforce the same access permission rules as the ubus based read call.

list.title: LuCI.fs#remove
list.description: Unlink the given file.

list.title: LuCI.fs#stat
list.description: Return file stat information on the specified path.

list.title: LuCI.fs#trimmed
list.description:
Read the contents of the given file, trim leading and trailing white space and return the trimmed result. In case of errors, return an empty string instead.

Note: this function is useful to read single-value files in /sys or /proc.

This function is guaranteed to not reject its promises, on failure, an empty string will be returned.

list.title: LuCI.fs#write
list.description:
Write the given data to the specified file path. If the specified file path does not exist, it will be created, given sufficient permissions.

Note: data will be converted to a string using String(data) or to '' when it is null.

list.title: LuCI.headers#get
list.description: Returns the value of the given header name. Note: Header-Names are case-insensitive.

list.title: LuCI.headers#has
list.description: Checks whether the given header name is present. Note: Header-Names are case-insensitive.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi
list.description:
CBI (Configuration Bindings Interface) helper utilities and DOM helpers.

Provides initialization for CBI UI elements, dependency handling, validation wiring and miscellaneous helpers used by LuCI forms. Functions defined here are registered as global window.* symbols.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~E
list.description: Create DOM elements using {@link L.dom.create} helper (convenience wrapper).

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~N_
list.description: Plural-aware translation lookup.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~_
list.description: Lookup a translated string for the given message and optional context. Falls back to the source string when no translation found.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_d_add
list.description: Register a dependency entry for a field.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_d_check
list.description: Evaluate a list of dependency descriptors and return whether any match.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_d_checkvalue
list.description: Check whether an input/select identified by target matches the given reference value.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_d_update
list.description: Update DOM nodes based on registered dependencies, showing or hiding nodes and restoring their order when dependency state changes.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_dropdown_init
list.description: Initialize a dropdown element into an {@link L.ui.Dropdown} instance and bind it. If already bound, this is a no-op.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_init
list.description: Initialize CBI widgets and wire up dependency and validation handlers. Walks the DOM looking for CBI-specific data attributes and replaces placeholders with interactive widgets.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_row_swap
list.description: Move a table row up or down within a section and update the storage field.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_submit
list.description: Submit a form, optionally adding a hidden input to pass a name/value pair.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_tag_last
list.description: Mark the last visible value container child with class cbi-value-last.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_update_table
list.description: Update or initialize a table UI widget with new data.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_validate_field
list.description: Attach a validator to a field and wire validation events.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_validate_form
list.description: Run all validators associated with a form and optionally show an error.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_validate_named_section_add
list.description: Enable/disable a named-section add button depending on input value.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~cbi_validate_reset
list.description: Trigger a delayed form validation (used to allow UI state to settle).

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~findParent
list.description: Find the parent matching selector from node upwards.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~isElem
list.description: Return the element for input which may be an element or an id.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~matchesElem
list.description: Test whether node matches a CSS selector.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~s8
list.description: Read signed 8-bit integer from a byte array at the given offset.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~sfh
list.description: Compute a stable 32-bit-ish string hash used for translation keys. Encodes UTF-8 surrogate pairs and mixes bytes into a hex hash string.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~trimws
list.description: Trim whitespace and normalise internal whitespace sequences to single spaces.

list.title: LuCI.module:cbi~u16
list.description: Read unsigned 16-bit little-endian integer from a byte array at offset.

list.title: LuCI.network#addNetwork
list.description:
Adds a new network of the given name and update it with the given uci option values.

If a network with the given name already exist but is empty, then this function will update its option, otherwise it will do nothing.

list.title: LuCI.network#addWifiNetwork
list.description: Adds a new wireless network to the configuration and sets its options to the provided values.

list.title: LuCI.network#deleteNetwork
list.description: Deletes the given network and its references from the network and firewall configuration.

list.title: LuCI.network#deleteWifiNetwork
list.description: Deletes the given wireless network from the configuration.

list.title: LuCI.network#flushCache
list.description: Flushes the local network state cache and fetches updated information from the remote ubus apis.

list.title: LuCI.network#formatWifiEncryption
list.description: Converts a given {@link LuCI.network.WifiEncryption encryption entry} into a human readable string such as mixed WPA/WPA2 PSK (TKIP, CCMP) or WPA3 SAE (CCMP).

list.title: LuCI.network#getDSLModemType
list.description: Queries the internal DSL modem type from board information.

list.title: LuCI.network#getDevice
list.description: Get a {@link LuCI.network.Device Device} instance describing the given network device.

list.title: LuCI.network#getDevices
list.description: Get a sorted list of all found network devices.

list.title: LuCI.network#getHostHints
list.description:
Queries aggregated information about known hosts.

This function aggregates information from various sources such as DHCP lease databases, ARP and IPv6 neighbour entries, wireless association list etc. and returns a {@link LuCI.network.Hosts Hosts} class instance describing the found hosts.

list.title: LuCI.network#getIfnameOf
list.description: Obtains the network device name of the given object.

list.title: LuCI.network#getNetwork
list.description: Get a {@link LuCI.network.Protocol Protocol} instance describing the network with the given name.

list.title: LuCI.network#getNetworks
list.description: Gets an array containing all known networks.

list.title: LuCI.network#getProtocol
list.description: Instantiates the given {@link LuCI.network.Protocol Protocol} back-end, optionally using the given network name.

list.title: LuCI.network#getProtocols
list.description: Obtains instances of all known {@link LuCI.network.Protocol Protocol} back-end classes.

list.title: LuCI.network#getSwitchTopologies
list.description: Returns the topologies of all swconfig switches found on the system.

list.title: LuCI.network#getWAN6Networks
list.description:
Get IPv6 wan networks.

This function looks up all networks having a default ::/0 route and returns them as an array.

list.title: LuCI.network#getWANNetworks
list.description:
Get IPv4 wan networks.

This function looks up all networks having a default 0.0.0.0/0 route and returns them as an array.

list.title: LuCI.network#getWifiDevice
list.description: Get a {@link LuCI.network.WifiDevice WifiDevice} instance describing the given wireless radio.

list.title: LuCI.network#getWifiDevices
list.description: Obtain a list of all configured radio devices.

list.title: LuCI.network#getWifiNetwork
list.description: Get a {@link LuCI.network.WifiNetwork WifiNetwork} instance describing the given wireless network.

list.title: LuCI.network#getWifiNetworks
list.description: Get an array of all {@link LuCI.network.WifiNetwork WifiNetwork} instances describing the wireless networks present on the system.

list.title: LuCI.network#isIgnoredDevice
list.description:
Test if a given network device name is in the list of patterns for device names to ignore.

Ignored device names are usually Linux network devices which are spawned implicitly by kernel modules such as tunl0 or hwsim0 and which are unsuitable for use in network configuration.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#deleteConfiguration
list.description:
Cleanup related configuration entries.

This function will be invoked if an interface is about to be removed from the configuration and is responsible for performing any required cleanup tasks, such as unsetting uci entries in related configurations.

It should be overridden by protocol specific subclasses.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#deleteDevice
list.description: Remove the given network device from the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#get
list.description: Read the given UCI option value of this network.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getDNS6Addrs
list.description: Query the IPv6 DNS servers associated with the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getDNSAddrs
list.description: Query the IPv4 DNS servers associated with the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getDevice
list.description: Returns the Linux network device associated with this logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getDevices
list.description: Returns a list of network sub-devices associated with this logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getErrors
list.description:
Query interface error messages published in ubus runtime state.

Interface errors are emitted by remote protocol handlers if the setup of the underlying logical interface failed, e.g. due to bad configuration or network connectivity issues.

This function will translate the found error codes to human readable messages using the descriptions registered by {@link LuCI.network#registerErrorCode Network.registerErrorCode()} and fall back to "Unknown error (%s)" where %s is replaced by the error code in case no translation can be found.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getExpiry
list.description:
Get the logical interface expiry time in seconds.

For protocols that have a concept of a lease, such as DHCP or DHCPv6, this function returns the remaining time in seconds until the lease expires.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getGateway6Addr
list.description: Query the gateway (nexthop) of the IPv6 default route associated with this logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getGatewayAddr
list.description: Query the gateway (nexthop) of the default route associated with this logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getI18n
list.description:
Return a human readable description for the protocol, such as Static address or DHCP client.

This function should be overridden by subclasses.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getIP6Addr
list.description: Query the first (primary) IPv6 address of the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getIP6Addrs
list.description: Query all IPv6 addresses of the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getIP6Prefix
list.description: Query the routed IPv6 prefix associated with the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getIP6Prefixes
list.description: Query the routed IPv6 prefixes associated with the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getIPAddr
list.description: Query the first (primary) IPv4 address of the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getIPAddrs
list.description: Query all IPv4 addresses of the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getIfname
list.description: Get the associated Linux network device of this network.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getL2Device
list.description: Returns the layer 2 Linux network device currently associated with this logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getL3Device
list.description: Returns the layer 3 Linux network device currently associated with this logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getMetric
list.description: Get the metric value of the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getName
list.description: Get the name of the associated logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getNetmask
list.description: Query the first (primary) IPv4 netmask of the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getPackageName
list.description:
Gets the name of the package providing the protocol functionality. The package is available via the system default package manager. This is used when a config refers to a protocol handler which is not yet installed.

This function should be overridden by protocol specific subclasses.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getProtocol
list.description:
Get the name of this network protocol class.

This function will be overridden by subclasses created by {@link LuCI.network#registerProtocol Network.registerProtocol()}.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getType
list.description:
Get the type of the underlying interface.

This function actually is a convenience wrapper around proto.get("type") and is mainly used by other LuCI.network code to check whether the interface is declared as bridge in UCI.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getUptime
list.description: Get the uptime of the logical interface.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#getZoneName
list.description:
Get the requested firewall zone name of the logical interface.

Some protocol implementations request a specific firewall zone to trigger inclusion of their resulting network devices into the firewall rule set.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#isAlias
list.description:
Checks whether this interface is an alias interface.

Alias interfaces are interfaces layering on top of another interface and are denoted by a special @interfacename notation in the underlying device option.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#isBridge
list.description: Checks whether the underlying logical interface is declared as bridge.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#isCreateable
list.description:
Check function for the protocol handler if a new interface is creatable.

This function should be overridden by protocol specific subclasses.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#isDynamic
list.description:
Checks whether this logical interface is dynamic.

A dynamic interface is an interface that has been created at runtime. E.g. as a sub-interface of another interface, but which is not backed by any user configuration. Such dynamic interfaces cannot be edited but only brought down or restarted.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#isEmpty
list.description: Checks whether this logical interface is "empty", where empty means that it has no network devices attached.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#isFloating
list.description:
Checks whether this protocol is "floating".

A "floating" protocol is a protocol which spawns its own interfaces on demand, like a virtual one but which relies on an existing lower level interface to initiate the connection.

An example for such a protocol is "pppoe".

This function exists for backwards compatibility with older code but should not be used anymore.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#isInstalled
list.description:
Checks whether the protocol functionality is installed.

This function exists for compatibility with old code, it always returns true.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#isPending
list.description: Checks whether this logical interface is pending.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#isUp
list.description: Checks whether this logical interface is configured and running.

list.title: LuCI.network.Protocol#isVirtual
list.description:
Checks whether this protocol is "virtual".

A "virtual" protocol is a protocol which spawns its own interfaces on demand instead of using existing physical interfaces.

Examples for virtual protocols are 6in4 which gre spawn a tunnel network device on startup, examples for non-virtual protocols are dhcp or static which apply IP configuration to existing interfaces.

This function should be overridden by subclasses.

list.title: LuCI.poll#active

list.title: LuCI.poll#remove
list.description: Remove an operation from the polling loop. If no further operations are registered, the polling loop is implicitly stopped.

list.title: LuCI.poll#start
list.description: (Re)start the polling loop. Dispatches a custom poll-start event to the document object upon successful start.

list.title: LuCI.poll#stop
list.description: Stop the polling loop. Dispatches a custom poll-stop event to the document object upon successful stop.

list.title: LuCI.request#addInterceptor
list.description: Register an HTTP response interceptor function. Interceptor functions are useful to perform default actions on incoming HTTP responses, such as checking for expired authentication or for implementing request retries before returning a failure.

list.title: LuCI.request#expandURL
list.description: Turn the given relative URL into an absolute URL if necessary.

list.title: LuCI.request#get
list.description: Initiate an HTTP GET request to the given target.

list.title: LuCI.request#handleReadyStateChange
list.description: Handle XHR readyState changes for an in-flight request and resolve or reject the originating promise.

list.title: LuCI.request#post
list.description: Initiate an HTTP POST request to the given target.

list.title: LuCI.request#removeInterceptor
list.description: Remove an HTTP response interceptor function. The passed function value must be the very same value that was used to register the function.

list.title: LuCI.request#request
list.description: Initiate an HTTP request to the given target.

list.title: LuCI.request.interceptorFn
list.description: Interceptor functions are invoked whenever an HTTP reply is received, in the order these functions have been registered.

list.title: LuCI.request.poll#active
list.description: Alias for {@link LuCI.poll.active LuCI.poll.active()}.

list.title: LuCI.request.poll#add
list.description: Register a repeating HTTP request with an optional callback to invoke whenever a response for the request is received.

list.title: LuCI.request.poll#remove
list.description: Remove a polling request that has been previously added using add(). This function is essentially a wrapper around {@link LuCI.poll.remove LuCI.poll.remove()}.

list.title: LuCI.request.poll#start
list.description: Alias for {@link LuCI.poll.start LuCI.poll.start()}.

list.title: LuCI.request.poll#stop
list.description: Alias for {@link LuCI.poll.stop LuCI.poll.stop()}.

list.title: LuCI.request.poll~callbackFn
list.description: The callback function is invoked whenever an HTTP reply to a polled request is received or when the polled request timed out.

list.title: LuCI.requestCallbackFn
list.description: The request callback function is invoked whenever an HTTP reply to a request made using the L.get(), L.post() or L.poll() function is timed out or received successfully.

list.title: LuCI.response#blob
list.description: Access the response content as blob.

list.title: LuCI.response#clone
list.description: Clones the given response object, optionally overriding the content of the cloned instance.

list.title: LuCI.response#duration
list.description: The total duration of the HTTP request in milliseconds

list.title: LuCI.response#headers
list.description: The HTTP headers of the response

list.title: LuCI.response#json
list.description: Access the response content as JSON data.

list.title: LuCI.response#ok
list.description: Describes whether the response is successful (status codes 200..299) or not

list.title: LuCI.response#status
list.description: The numeric HTTP status code of the response

list.title: LuCI.response#statusText
list.description: The HTTP status description message of the response

list.title: LuCI.response#text

list.title: LuCI.response#url
