list.title: LuCI.rpc#addInterceptor
list.description: Registers a new interceptor function.

list.title: LuCI.rpc#declare
list.description: Describes a remote RPC call procedure and returns a function implementing it.

list.title: LuCI.rpc#getBaseURL
list.description: Returns the current RPC base URL.

list.title: LuCI.rpc#getSessionID
list.description: Returns the current RPC session id.

list.title: LuCI.rpc#getStatusText
list.description: Translates a numeric ubus error code into a human readable description.

list.title: LuCI.rpc#list
list.description:
Lists available remote ubus objects or the method signatures of specific objects.

This function has two signatures and is sensitive to the number of arguments passed to it:

  • list() - Returns an array containing the names of all remote ubus objects
  • list("objname", ...) Returns method signatures for each given ubus object name.

list.title: LuCI.rpc#removeInterceptor
list.description: Removes a registered interceptor function.

list.title: LuCI.rpc#setBaseURL
list.description: Set the RPC base URL to use.

list.title: LuCI.rpc#setSessionID
list.description: Set the RPC session id to use.

list.title: LuCI.rpc.filterFn
list.description: The filter function is invoked to transform a received ubus RPC call reply before returning it to the caller.

list.title: LuCI.rpc.invokeFn
list.description:
The generated invocation function is returned by {@link LuCI.rpc#declare rpc.declare()} and encapsulates a single RPC method call.

Calling this function will execute a remote ubus HTTP call request using the arguments passed to it as arguments and return a promise resolving to the received reply values.

list.title: LuCI.rpc~interceptorFn
list.description:
Registered interceptor functions are invoked before the standard reply parsing and handling logic.

By returning rejected promises, interceptor functions can cause the invocation function to fail, regardless of the received reply.

Interceptors may also modify their message argument in-place to rewrite received replies before they're processed by the standard response handling code.

A common use case for such functions is to detect failing RPC replies due to expired authentication in order to trigger a new login.

list.title: LuCI.session#getID
list.description: Retrieve the current session ID.

list.title: LuCI.session#getLocalData
list.description: Retrieve data from the local session storage.

list.title: LuCI.session#getToken
list.description: Retrieve the current session token.

list.title: LuCI.session#setLocalData
list.description: Set data in the local session storage.

list.title: LuCI.uci#add
list.description: Adds a new section of the given type to the given configuration, optionally named according to the given name.

list.title: LuCI.uci#apply
list.description: Instructs the remote ubus UCI api to commit all saved changes with rollback protection and attempts to confirm the pending commit operation to cancel the rollback timer.

list.title: LuCI.uci#changes
list.description: Fetches uncommitted UCI changes from the remote ubus RPC api.

list.title: LuCI.uci#clone
list.description: Clones an existing section of the given type to the given configuration, optionally named according to the given name.

list.title: LuCI.uci#createSID
list.description:
Generates a new, unique section ID for the given configuration.

Note that the generated ID is temporary, it will get replaced by an identifier in the form cfgXXXXXX once the configuration is saved by the remote ubus UCI api.

list.title: LuCI.uci#get
list.description: Gets the value of the given option within the specified section of the given configuration or the entire section object if the option name is omitted.

list.title: LuCI.uci#get_bool
list.description:
A special case of get that always returns either true or false.

Many configuration files contain boolean settings, such as enabled or advanced_mode, where there is no consistent definition for the values. This function allows users to enter any of the values "yes", "on", "true", "enabled" or 1 in their config files and we return the expected boolean result.

Character case is not significant, so for example, any of "YES", "Yes" or "yes" will be interpreted as a true value.

list.title: LuCI.uci#get_first
list.description: Gets the value of the given option or the entire section object of the first found section of the specified type or the first found section of the entire configuration if no type is specified.

list.title: LuCI.uci#load
list.description:
Loads the given UCI configurations from the remote ubus api.

Loaded configurations are cached and only loaded once. Subsequent load operations of the same configurations will return the cached data.

To force reloading a configuration, it has to be unloaded with {@link LuCI.uci#unload uci.unload()} first.

list.title: LuCI.uci#move
list.description: Move the first specified section within the given configuration before or after the second specified section.

list.title: LuCI.uci#remove
list.description: Removes the section with the given ID from the given configuration.

list.title: LuCI.uci#resolveSID
list.description: Resolves a given section ID in extended notation to the internal section ID value.

list.title: LuCI.uci#save
list.description: Submits all local configuration changes to the remove ubus api, adds, removes and reorders remote sections as needed and reloads all loaded configurations to resynchronize the local state with the remote configuration values.

list.title: LuCI.uci#sections
list.description: Enumerates the sections of the given configuration, optionally filtered by type.

list.title: LuCI.uci#set
list.description:
Sets the value of the given option within the specified section of the given configuration.

If either config, section or option is null, or if option begins with a dot, the function will do nothing.

list.title: LuCI.uci#set_first
list.description:
Sets the value of the given option within the first found section of the given configuration matching the specified type or within the first section of the entire config when no type has is specified.

If either config, type or option is null, or if option begins with a dot, the function will do nothing.

list.title: LuCI.uci#unload
list.description: Unloads the given UCI configurations from the local cache.

list.title: LuCI.uci#unset
list.description:
Remove the given option within the specified section of the given configuration.

This function is a convenience wrapper around uci.set(config, section, option, null).

list.title: LuCI.uci#unset_first
list.description:
Removes the given option within the first found section of the given configuration matching the specified type or within the first section of the entire config when no type has is specified.

This function is a convenience wrapper around uci.set_first(config, type, option, null).

list.title: LuCI.uci.ChangeRecord
list.description: An UCI change record is a plain array containing the change operation name as first element, the affected section ID as second argument and an optional third and fourth argument whose meanings depend on the operation.

list.title: LuCI.uci.SectionObject
list.description:
A section object represents the options and their corresponding values enclosed within a configuration section, as well as some additional meta data such as sort indexes and internal ID.

Any internal metadata fields are prefixed with a dot which isn't an allowed character for normal option names.

list.title: LuCI.uci.sections
list.description: The sections callback is invoked for each section found within the given configuration and receives the section object and its associated name as arguments.

list.title: LuCI.ui#addNotification
list.description:
Add a notification banner at the top of the current view.

A notification banner is an alert message usually displayed at the top of the current view, spanning the entire available width. Notification banners will stay in place until dismissed by the user. Multiple banners may be shown at the same time.

Additional CSS class names may be passed to influence the appearance of the banner. Valid values for the classes depend on the underlying theme.

list.title: LuCI.ui#addTimeLimitedNotification
list.description:
Add a time-limited notification banner at the top of the current view.

A notification banner is an alert message usually displayed at the top of the current view, spanning the entire available width. Notification banners will stay in place until dismissed by the user, or it has expired. Multiple banners may be shown at the same time.

Additional CSS class names may be passed to influence the appearance of the banner. Valid values for the classes depend on the underlying theme.

list.title: LuCI.ui#addTimeLimitedNotification~fadeOutNotification
list.description: Set node parameters to fade the notification out after timeout.

list.title: LuCI.ui#addValidator
list.description:
Add validation constraints to an input element.

Compile the given type expression and optional validator function into a validation function and bind it to the specified input element events.

list.title: LuCI.ui#awaitReconnect
list.description:
Wait for device to come back online and reconnect to it.

Poll each given hostname or IP address and navigate to it as soon as one of the addresses becomes reachable.

list.title: LuCI.ui#createHandlerFn
list.description:
Create a pre-bound event handler function.

Generate and bind a function suitable for use in event handlers. The generated function automatically disables the event source element and adds an active indication to it by adding appropriate CSS classes.

It will also await any promises returned by the wrapped function and re-enable the source element after the promises ran to completion.

list.title: LuCI.ui#hideIndicator
list.description:
Remove a header area indicator.

This function removes the given indicator label from the header indicator area. When the given indicator is not found, this function does nothing.

list.title: LuCI.ui#hideModal
list.description:
Close the open modal overlay dialog.

This function will close an open modal dialog and restore the normal view behaviour. It has no effect if no modal dialog is currently open.

Note that this function is stand-alone, it does not rely on this and will not invoke other class functions so it is suitable to be used as event handler as-is without the need to bind it first.

list.title: LuCI.ui#instantiateView
list.description:
Load specified view class path and set it up.

Transforms the given view path into a class name, requires it using [LuCI.require()]{@link LuCI#require} and asserts that the resulting class instance is a descendant of [LuCI.view]{@link LuCI.view}.

By instantiating the view class, its corresponding contents are rendered and included into the view area. Any runtime errors are caught and rendered using [LuCI.error()]{@link LuCI#error}.

list.title: LuCI.ui#itemlist
list.description:
Formats a series of label/value pairs into list-like markup.

This function transforms a flat array of alternating label and value elements into a list-like markup, using the values in separators as separators and appends the resulting nodes to the given parent DOM node.

Each label is suffixed with : and wrapped into a <strong> tag, the <strong> element and the value corresponding to the label are subsequently wrapped into a <span class="nowrap"> element.

The resulting <span> element tuples are joined by the given separators to form the final markup which is appended to the given parent DOM node.

list.title: LuCI.ui#pingDevice
list.description:
Perform a device connectivity test.

Attempt to fetch a well known resource from the remote device via HTTP in order to test connectivity. This function is mainly useful to wait for the router to come back online after a reboot or reconfiguration.

list.title: LuCI.ui#showIndicator
list.description:
Display or update a header area indicator.

An indicator is a small label displayed in the header area of the screen providing few amounts of status information such as item counts or state toggle indicators.

Multiple indicators may be shown at the same time and indicator labels may be made clickable to display extended information or to initiate further actions.

Indicators can either use a default active or a less accented inactive style which is useful for indicators representing state toggles.

list.title: LuCI.ui#showModal
list.description:
Display a modal overlay dialog with the specified contents.

The modal overlay dialog covers the current view preventing interaction with the underlying view contents. Only one modal dialog instance can be opened. Invoking showModal() while a modal dialog is already open will replace the open dialog with a new one having the specified contents.

Additional CSS class names may be passed to influence the appearance of the dialog. Valid values for the classes depend on the underlying theme.

list.title: LuCI.ui#uploadFile
list.description:
Display a modal file upload prompt.

This function opens a modal dialog prompting the user to select and upload a file to a predefined remote destination path.

list.title: LuCI.ui.AbstractElement#getValidationError
list.description: Returns the current validation error

list.title: LuCI.ui.AbstractElement#getValue
list.description: Read the current value of the input widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.AbstractElement#isChanged
list.description: Check whether the input value was altered by the user.

list.title: LuCI.ui.AbstractElement#isValid
list.description: Check whether the current input value is valid.

list.title: LuCI.ui.AbstractElement#registerEvents
list.description:
Dispatch a custom (synthetic) event in response to received events.

Sets up event handlers on the given target DOM node for the given event names that dispatch a custom event of the given type to the widget root DOM node.

The primary purpose of this function is to set up a series of custom uniform standard events such as widget-update, validation-success, validation-failure etc. which are triggered by various different widget specific native DOM events.

list.title: LuCI.ui.AbstractElement#render
list.description: Render the widget, set up event listeners and return resulting markup.

list.title: LuCI.ui.AbstractElement#setChangeEvents
list.description:
Set up listeners for native DOM events that may change the widget value.

Sets up event handlers on the given target DOM node for the given event names which may cause the input value to change completely, such as change events in a select menu. In contrast to update events, such change events will not trigger input value validation but they may cause field dependencies to get re-evaluated and will mark the input widget as dirty.

list.title: LuCI.ui.AbstractElement#setPlaceholder
list.description: Set the current placeholder value of the input widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.AbstractElement#setUpdateEvents
list.description:
Set up listeners for native DOM events that may update the widget value.

Sets up event handlers on the given target DOM node for the given event names which may cause the input value to update, such as keyup or onclick events. In contrast to change events, such update events will trigger input value validation.

list.title: LuCI.ui.AbstractElement#setValue
list.description: Set the current value of the input widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.AbstractElement#triggerValidation
list.description:
Force validation of the current input value.

Usually input validation is automatically triggered by various DOM events bound to the input widget. In some cases it is required though to manually trigger validation runs, e.g. when programmatically altering values.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Checkbox
list.description: Instantiate a checkbox widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Checkbox#isChecked
list.description: Test whether the checkbox is currently checked.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Checkbox.InitOptions
list.description: In addition to the [AbstractElement.InitOptions]{@link LuCI.ui.AbstractElement.InitOptions} the following properties are recognized:

list.title: LuCI.ui.ComboButton
list.description: Instantiate a combo button widget offering multiple action choices.

list.title: LuCI.ui.ComboButton.InitOptions
list.description: ComboButtons support the same properties as [Dropdown.InitOptions]{@link LuCI.ui.Dropdown.InitOptions} but enforce specific values for some properties and add additional button specific properties.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Combobox
list.description: Instantiate a rich dropdown choice widget allowing custom values.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Combobox.InitOptions
list.description: Comboboxes support the same properties as [Dropdown.InitOptions]{@link LuCI.ui.Dropdown.InitOptions} but enforce specific values for the following properties:

list.title: LuCI.ui.Dropdown
list.description: Instantiate a rich dropdown choice widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Dropdown#addChoices
list.description:
Add new choices to the dropdown menu.

This function adds further choices to an existing dropdown menu, ignoring choice values which are already present.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Dropdown#clearChoices
list.description:
Remove all existing choices from the dropdown menu.

This function removes all preexisting dropdown choices from the widget, keeping only choices currently being selected unless reset_values is given, in which case all choices and deselected and removed.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Dropdown#closeAllDropdowns
list.description: Close all open dropdown widgets in the current document.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Dropdown.InitOptions
list.description: In addition to the [AbstractElement.InitOptions]{@link LuCI.ui.AbstractElement.InitOptions} the following properties are recognized:

list.title: LuCI.ui.DynamicList
list.description: Instantiate a dynamic list widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.DynamicList#addChoices
list.description:
Add new suggested choices to the dynamic list.

This function adds further choices to an existing dynamic list, ignoring choice values which are already present.

list.title: LuCI.ui.DynamicList#clearChoices
list.description:
Remove all existing choices from the dynamic list.

This function removes all preexisting suggested choices from the widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.DynamicList.InitOptions
list.description: In case choices are passed to the dynamic list constructor, the widget supports the same properties as [Dropdown.InitOptions]{@link LuCI.ui.Dropdown.InitOptions} but enforces specific values for some dropdown properties.

list.title: LuCI.ui.FileUpload
list.description: Instantiate a file upload widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.FileUpload.InitOptions
list.description: In addition to the [AbstractElement.InitOptions]{@link LuCI.ui.AbstractElement.InitOptions} the following properties are recognized:

list.title: LuCI.ui.Hiddenfield
list.description: Instantiate a hidden input field widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.RangeSlider
list.description: Instantiate a range slider widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.RangeSlider#getCalculatedValue
list.description: Return the value calculated by the calculate function.

list.title: LuCI.ui.RangeSlider.InitOptions
list.description: In addition to the [AbstractElement.InitOptions]{@link LuCI.ui.AbstractElement.InitOptions} the following properties are recognized:

list.title: LuCI.ui.Select
list.description: Instantiate a select dropdown or checkbox/radiobutton group.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Select.InitOptions
list.description: In addition to the [AbstractElement.InitOptions]{@link LuCI.ui.AbstractElement.InitOptions} the following properties are recognized:

list.title: LuCI.ui.Textarea
list.description: Instantiate a textarea widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Textarea.InitOptions
list.description: In addition to the [AbstractElement.InitOptions]{@link LuCI.ui.AbstractElement.InitOptions} the following properties are recognized:

list.title: LuCI.ui.Textfield
list.description: Instantiate a text input widget.

list.title: LuCI.ui.Textfield.InitOptions
list.description: In addition to the [AbstractElement.InitOptions]{@link LuCI.ui.AbstractElement.InitOptions} the following properties are recognized:

list.title: LuCI.ui.changes#apply
list.description:
Apply the staged configuration changes.

Start applying staged configuration changes and open a modal dialog with a progress indication to prevent interaction with the view during the apply process. The modal dialog will be automatically closed and the current view reloaded once the apply process is complete.

list.title: LuCI.ui.changes#displayChanges
list.description:
Display the current changelog.

Open a modal dialog visualizing the currently staged UCI changes and offer options to revert or apply the shown changes.

list.title: LuCI.ui.changes#renderChangeIndicator
list.description:
Update the change count indicator.

This function updates the UCI change count indicator from the given UCI changeset structure.

list.title: LuCI.ui.changes#revert
list.description:
Revert the staged configuration changes.

Start reverting staged configuration changes and open a modal dialog with a progress indication to prevent interaction with the view during the revert process. The modal dialog will be automatically closed and the current view reloaded once the revert process is complete.

list.title: LuCI.ui.changes#setIndicator
list.description:
Set the change count indicator.

This function updates or hides the UCI change count indicator, depending on the passed change count. When the count is greater than 0, the change indicator is displayed or updated, otherwise it is removed.

list.title: LuCI.ui.menu
list.description: Handle menu.

list.title: LuCI.ui.menu#flushCache
list.description: Flush the internal menu cache to force loading a new structure on the next page load.

list.title: LuCI.ui.menu#load
list.description: Load and cache current menu tree.

list.title: LuCI.ui.tabs#initTabGroup
list.description:
Initializes a new tab group from the given tab pane collection.

This function cycles through the given tab pane DOM nodes, extracts their tab IDs, titles and active states, renders a corresponding tab menu and prepends it to the tab panes common parent DOM node.

The tab menu labels will be set to the value of the data-tab-title attribute of each corresponding pane. The last pane with the data-tab-active attribute set to true will be selected by default.

If no pane is marked as active, the first one will be preselected.

list.title: LuCI.ui.tabs#isEmptyPane
list.description: Checks whether the given tab pane node is empty.

list.title: LuCI.validation.Validator#apply
list.description: Apply a validation function by name or directly via function reference. If a name is provided it resolves it via the factory's registered types.

list.title: LuCI.validation.Validator#assert
list.description: Assert a condition and update field error state.

list.title: LuCI.validation.Validator#validate
list.description: Validate the associated field value using the compiled validator stack and any additional validators provided at construction time. Emits 'validation-failure' or 'validation-success' CustomEvents on the field.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory#compile
list.description: Compile a validator expression string into an internal stack representation.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory#create
list.description: Compile a validator expression string into an internal stack representation.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory#parseDecimal
list.description: Parse a decimal number string. Returns NaN when not a valid number.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory#parseIPv4
list.description: Parse IPv4 address into an array of 4 octets or return null on failure.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory#parseIPv6
list.description: Parse IPv6 address into an array of 8 16-bit words or return null on failure. Supports IPv4-embedded IPv6 (::ffff:a.b.c.d) and zero-compression.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory#parseInteger
list.description: Parse an integer string. Returns NaN when not a valid integer.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types
list.description:
Collection of type handlers. Each function consumes this.value and returns this.assert to report errors.

All functions return the result of {@link LuCI.validation.Validator#assert assert()}.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#and
list.description:
Logical AND && to build more complex expressions. Enforces all types on the input string.

See also {@link LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#or or}

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#cidr
list.description: Assert a IPv4/6 CIDR.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#cidr4
list.description: Assert a IPv4 CIDR.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#cidr6
list.description: Assert a IPv6 CIDR.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#dateyyyymmdd
list.description: Assert a string of the form YYYY-MM-DD.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#device
list.description: Assert a device string. This is a hold-over from Lua to maintain compatibility and is a stub function.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#directory
list.description: Assert a directory string. This is a hold-over from Lua to maintain compatibility and is a stub function.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#file
list.description: Assert a file string. This is a hold-over from Lua to maintain compatibility and is a stub function.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#float
list.description: Assert a signed float value (+/-).

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#hexstring
list.description: Assert a hexadecimal string.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#host
list.description: Assert a valid hostname or IP address.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#hostname
list.description: Validate hostname according to common rules.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#hostport
list.description: Assert a valid host:port.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#integer
list.description: Assert a signed integer value (+/-).

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ip4addr
list.description: Assert an IPv4 address.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ip4addrport
list.description: Assert a valid IPv4 address:port. E.g. 192.0.2.10:80

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ip4prefix
list.description: Assert an IPv4 prefix.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ip6addr
list.description: Assert an IPv6 address.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ip6hostid
list.description: Assert a IPv6 host ID.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ip6ll
list.description: Assert an IPv6 Link Local address.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ip6prefix
list.description: Assert an IPv6 prefix.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ip6ula
list.description: Assert an IPv6 UL address.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ipaddr
list.description: Assert an IPv4/6 address.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ipaddrport
list.description: Assert a valid IPv4/6 address:port. E.g. 192.0.2.10:80 or [2001:db8:f00d:cafe::1]:8080

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ipmask
list.description: Assert an IPv4/6 network in address/netmask (CIDR or mask) notation.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ipmask4
list.description: Assert an IPv4 network in address/netmask (CIDR or mask) notation.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ipmask6
list.description: Assert an IPv6 network in address/netmask (CIDR or mask) notation.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ipnet4
list.description: Assert an IPv4 network in address/netmask notation. E.g. 192.0.2.1/255.255.255.0

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ipnet6
list.description: Assert an IPv6 network in address/netmask notation. E.g. 2001:db8:dead:beef::0001/ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff::

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#iprange
list.description: Assert a valid IPv4/6 address range.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#iprange4
list.description: Assert a valid IPv4 address range. E.g. 192.0.2.1-192.0.2.254.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#iprange6
list.description: Assert a valid IPv6 address range. E.g. 2001:db8:0f00:0000::-2001:db8:0f00:0000:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#length
list.description: Assert a string of [bytelen]{@link LuCI.validation.bytelen} length len characters.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#list
list.description: Assert a list of a type.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#macaddr
list.description: Assert a valid (multicast) MAC address.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#max
list.description: Assert a decimal value lesser or equal to max.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#maxlength
list.description: Assert a value of [bytelen]{@link LuCI.validation.bytelen} with at most max characters.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#min
list.description: Assert a decimal value greater or equal to min.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#minlength
list.description: Assert a value of [bytelen]{@link LuCI.validation.bytelen} with at least min characters.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#neg
list.description:
Assert any type, optionally preceded by !.

Example:list(neg(macaddr)) mandates a list of MAC values, which may also be prefixed with a single !; the MAC strings are validated after ! are removed from all entries.

01:02:03:04:05:06
!01:02:03:04:05:07
01:02:03:04:05:08

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#netdevname
list.description: Assert a valid network device name between 1 and 15 characters not containing ":", "/", "%" or spaces.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#network
list.description: Assert a valid UCI identifier, hostname or IP address range.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#or
list.description:
Logical OR || to build a more complex expression. Allows multiple types within a single field.

See also {@link LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#and and}

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#phonedigit
list.description: Assert a valid phone number dial string: [0-9*#!.]+.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#port
list.description: Assert a valid port value where 0 <= port <= 65535.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#portrange
list.description: Assert a valid port or port range (port1-port2) where both ports are positive integers, port1 <= port2 and port2 <= 65535 (2^16 - 1).

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#range
list.description: Assert a decimal value between min and max.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#rangelength
list.description: Assert a string value of [bytelen]{@link LuCI.validation.bytelen} length between min and max characters.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#sep
list.description: Define a string separator sep for use in [tuple]{@link LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#tuple}.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#string
list.description: Assert a string type, optionally matching param.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#timehhmmss
list.description: Assert a string of the form HH:MM:SS.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#tuple
list.description:
Tuple validator: accepts 1-N tokens separated by a given separator {@link LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#sep sep} (whitespace by default if {@link LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#sep sep} is omitted) which will be validated against the 1-N types.

This differs from {@link LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#and and} by first splitting the input and applying each validator function sequentially on the resulting array of the split string, whereby the first type applies to the first value element, the second to the second, and so on, to define a concrete order.

{@link LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#sep sep} can appear at any position in the list.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ucifw4zonename
list.description: Assert a valid fw4 zone name UCI identifier: [a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]+

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#uciname
list.description: Assert a valid UCI identifier: [a-zA-Z0-9_]+.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#ufloat
list.description: Assert an unsigned float value (+).

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#uinteger
list.description: Assert an unsigned integer value (+).

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#unique
list.description: Assert unique values among lists.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#wepkey
list.description: Assert a valid (hexadecimal) WEP key.

list.title: LuCI.validation.ValidatorFactory.types#wpakey
list.description: Assert a valid (hexadecimal) WPA key of 8 <= length <= 63, or hex if length == 64.

list.title: LuCI.validation.arrayle
list.description: Compare two arrays element-wise: return true if a < b in lexicographic element comparison.

list.title: LuCI.validation.bytelen
list.description: Return byte length of a string using Blob (UTF-8 byte count).

list.title: LuCI.view#addFooter
list.description:
Renders a standard page action footer if any of the handleSave(), handleSaveApply() or handleReset() functions are defined.

The default implementation should be sufficient for most views - it will render a standard page footer with action buttons labeled Save, Save & Apply and Reset triggering the handleSave(), handleSaveApply() and handleReset() functions respectively.

When any of these handle*() functions is overwritten with null by a view extending this class, the corresponding button will not be rendered.

list.title: LuCI.view#handleReset
list.description:
The handleReset function is invoked when the user clicks the Reset button in the page action footer.

The default implementation should be sufficient for most views using {@link form#Map form.Map()} based forms - it will iterate all forms present in the view and invoke the {@link form#Map#save Map.reset()} method on each form.

Views not using Map instances or requiring other special logic should overwrite handleReset() with a custom implementation.

To disable the Reset page footer button, views extending this base class should overwrite the handleReset function with null.

The invocation of this function is wrapped by Promise.resolve() so it may return Promises if needed.

list.title: LuCI.view#handleSave
list.description:
The handleSave function is invoked when the user clicks the Save button in the page action footer.

The default implementation should be sufficient for most views using {@link form#Map form.Map()} based forms - it will iterate all forms present in the view and invoke the {@link form#Map#save Map.save()} method on each form.

Views not using Map instances or requiring other special logic should overwrite handleSave() with a custom implementation.

To disable the Save page footer button, views extending this base class should overwrite the handleSave function with null.

The invocation of this function is wrapped by Promise.resolve() so it may return Promises if needed.

list.title: LuCI.view#handleSaveApply
list.description:
The handleSaveApply function is invoked when the user clicks the Save & Apply button in the page action footer.

The default implementation should be sufficient for most views using {@link form#Map form.Map()} based forms - it will first invoke {@link LuCI.view.handleSave view.handleSave()} and then call {@link ui#changes#apply ui.changes.apply()} to start the modal config apply and page reload flow.

Views not using Map instances or requiring other special logic should overwrite handleSaveApply() with a custom implementation.

To disable the Save & Apply page footer button, views extending this base class should overwrite the handleSaveApply function with null.

The invocation of this function is wrapped by Promise.resolve() so it may return Promises if needed.

list.title: LuCI.view#load
list.description:
The load function is invoked before the view is rendered.

The invocation of this function is wrapped by Promise.resolve() so it may return Promises if needed.

The return value of the function (or the resolved values of the promise returned by it) will be passed as the first argument to render().

This function is supposed to be overwritten by subclasses, the default implementation does nothing.

list.title: LuCI.view#render
list.description:
The render function is invoked after the {@link LuCI.view#load load()} function and responsible for setting up the view contents. It must return a DOM Node or DocumentFragment holding the contents to insert into the view area.

The invocation of this function is wrapped by Promise.resolve() so it may return Promises if needed.

The return value of the function (or the resolved values of the promise returned by it) will be inserted into the main content area using {@link LuCI.dom#append dom.append()}.

This function is supposed to be overwritten by subclasses, the default implementation does nothing.

list.title: LuCI.xhr#abort
list.description:
Ignored for backwards compatibility.

This function does nothing.

list.title: LuCI.xhr#busy
list.description: Checks the running state of the request.

list.title: LuCI.xhr#cancel
list.description:
Cancels a running request.

This function does not actually cancel the underlying XMLHTTPRequest request but it sets a flag which prevents the invocation of the callback function when the request eventually finishes or timed out.

list.title: LuCI.xhr#get
list.description: This function is a legacy wrapper around {@link LuCI#get LuCI.get()}.

list.title: LuCI.xhr#post
list.description: This function is a legacy wrapper around {@link LuCI#post LuCI.post()}.

list.title: LuCI.xhr#send_form
list.description:
Existing for backwards compatibility.

This function simply throws an InternalError when invoked.

list.title: add
list.description:
Add a small integer to a 64-bit value represented as four 16-bit words.

Treats a as a little-endian 64-bit value (4 16-bit words). Adds the integer n to the least-significant word and propagates carry across subsequent 16-bit words. The result is truncated to 64 bits and returned as a 4-element array of 16-bit words (little-endian).

list.title: calculateBroadcast
list.description: Calculate the broadcast IP for a given IP.

list.title: derive_color
list.description:
Derive a deterministic hex color from an input string.

The color is produced by seeding the PRNG from a string-derived hash and producing RGB components. Returns a #rrggbb hex string.

  • get(upper) -> integer in [1, upper]
  • get(lower, upper) -> integer in [lower, upper]

Advances the internal state and returns a 32-bit pseudo-random integer derived from the current state.

list.title: mul
list.description:
Multiply two 64-bit values represented as arrays of four 16-bit words.

Arrays use little-endian word order (least-significant 16-bit word first). The result is truncated to the lower 64 bits and returned as a 4-element array of 16-bit words.

list.description: Erase the menu node

list.title: seed
list.description:
Seed the PRNG state.

The seed is treated as a 32-bit integer; the lower 16 bits are stored in s[0], the upper 16 bits in s[1]. s[2] and s[3] are zeroed.

list.title: shr
list.description:
Shift a 64-bit value (4 16-bit words, little-endian) right by n bits.

The input array is treated as little-endian 16-bit words. Bits shifted out on the right are discarded; the returned array contains the lower 64-bit result after the logical right shift.
